errors.nameMin: Name must have at least 2 characters
errors.passwordMin: Password must have at least 6 characters

hero.title: Detect your stress. Live lighter.
hero.description: MinDora helps adults aged 20-50 to identify and manage work stress with quick self-assessments, analysis of visible body signals (posture, facial tension, breathing) and personalized recommendations. You can also contact psychologists from the app.
hero.noSpam: No spam. You can cancel anytime.

phone.howFeeling: How are you feeling right now?

features.desc1: Identify stress early by observing visible body signals such as posture, facial tension, and breathing.
features.desc2: Combine emotional tests with physical symptom tracking for a complete overview.
features.desc3: Breathing exercises, active breaks, and tips adapted to your work context.
features.desc4: View trends, identify peaks, and measure your progress over time.
features.desc5: Access specialists in work-related stress and book appointments directly from the platform.
features.desc6: Your data is encrypted and you decide what to share. Designed for personal and corporate use.

how.title: How does Mindora work?
how.subtitle: We guide you step by step to reduce stress and improve your wellbeing.

step1.title: Check your stress level
step1.desc: Answer a specialist-designed test and understand how you're really feeling.

step2.title: Get a personalized plan
step2.desc: Mindora analyzes your results and recommends habits, exercises, and routines.

step3.title: Improve day by day
step3.desc: Track your progress and build a calmer, more balanced life.

pricing.title: Mindora Plans
pricing.subtitle: Start free and upgrade when you need.

q1.title: Do I need a wearable?
q1.desc: No. Wearables are optional â€” manual check-ins work very well and keep you in control.

q2.title: How do you generate recommendations?
q2.desc: We combine your check-ins with sleep/activity patterns and observable physical signals to suggest the best moment and type of intervention.

q3.title: Is my data private?
q3.desc: Yes. We encrypt your data in transit and at rest. You can export or delete it anytime. For companies, we provide aggregated and anonymous reports.

q4.title: Can I contact a specialist?
q4.desc: Yes. You can search for psychologists specialized in work stress and book appointments through the platform.

cta.title: Ready to regain your balance?
cta.description: Build wellness habits through small steps that truly stick.

footer.description: Your mental wellness companion. Professional support for a healthier, happier you.

breathing.inProgress: You have a session in progress.

coaching.title: Coaching & Community
coaching.subtitle: Connect with specialists and a support community

community.title: Support community
community.description: Share experiences, find motivation, and learn from others on your wellness journey.

triggers.title: Stress triggers
triggers.empty: No triggers yet. Add the first one to start learning your patterns.

share.title: Share report with a specialist
share.success: Link generated. Copy and send it to the specialist:

appointments.bookFirst: Book your first session with a specialist
appointments.confirmCancelMsg: Are you sure you want to cancel this appointment?

stressLevel.title: Current Stress Level
stressLevel.recommendation: We recommend doing breathing exercises and considering a session with a specialist.

community.title: Community
community.description: Connect with specialists and other users

wellnessTips.title: Wellness Tip
wellnessTips.tip1: Take 5 minutes to practice deep breathing. It can significantly reduce your stress level.

questions.work_1: Do you feel overwhelmed by the amount of work?
questions.work_2: Do you have difficulty disconnecting from work outside of work hours?
questions.work_3: Do you feel you have no control over your work tasks?
questions.work_4: Do you experience conflicts with colleagues or supervisors?
questions.work_5: Are you worried about your performance or job security?
questions.sleep_1: Do you have difficulty falling asleep?
questions.sleep_2: Do you wake up during the night and have trouble falling back asleep?
questions.sleep_3: Do you feel tired when you wake up, even after sleeping?
questions.physical_2: Do you feel muscle tension or pain in your neck/shoulders?
questions.physical_3: Do you have digestive problems or stomach discomfort?
questions.physical_4: Do you notice changes in your appetite (eating more or less than usual)?
questions.emotional_1: Do you feel anxious or nervous for no apparent reason?
questions.emotional_2: Do you experience mood swings or irritability?
questions.emotional_3: Do you feel sad, unmotivated, or lacking energy?

description.low: Your stress level is within a healthy range. Continue with your wellness habits.
description.moderate: Your stress level is moderate. It's important to take steps to manage it before it increases.
description.high: Your stress level is high. We recommend seeking professional support and applying stress management techniques.

recommendations.low_1: Maintain your current exercise and rest routines
recommendations.moderate_2: Establish clear boundaries between work and personal life
recommendations.moderate_3: Consider talking to a professional about stress management techniques
recommendations.moderate_4: Prioritize activities that help you relax and disconnect
recommendations.high_1: Schedule a consultation with a psychologist specialized in stress management
recommendations.high_2: Implement regular breaks during the day for relaxation exercises
recommendations.high_3: Evaluate your workload and communicate your needs to your supervisor
recommendations.high_4: Consider techniques such as meditation, yoga, or cognitive-behavioral therapy

tracking.title: Assessment & Tracking
tracking.subtitle: Monitor your mental health journey and track your progress over time
tracking.reminderDescription: Set up recurring reminders to track your stress levels regularly
tracking.noHistory: No assessments yet. Take your first assessment to start tracking!

recommendations.noData: Take your first assessment to receive personalized recommendations
recommendations.improving: Great progress! Your stress levels are improving. Keep up the good work with your current strategies.
recommendations.stable: Your stress levels are stable. Continue with your current wellness practices.
recommendations.declining: Your stress levels are increasing. Consider scheduling a session with a specialist and increasing your self-care activities.
recommendations.highStress: Your stress level is high. We strongly recommend speaking with a mental health professional.
recommendations.moderateStress: Your stress level is moderate. Focus on stress management techniques and regular self-care.
recommendations.lowStress: Your stress level is low. Maintain your healthy habits and continue monitoring your well-being.

category.work: Work stress is your highest category. Consider setting better boundaries and taking regular breaks.
category.sleep: Sleep quality is affecting your stress. Establish a consistent sleep routine and create a relaxing bedtime environment.
category.physical: Physical symptoms are prominent. Incorporate regular exercise and relaxation techniques into your routine.
category.emotional: Emotional well-being needs attention. Consider mindfulness practices and connecting with supportive people.

routines.title: Daily Routines
routines.subtitle: Simple exercises to reduce stress throughout your day

breathing.title: Deep Breathing
breathing.description: Calm your mind and body with controlled breathing
steps: Find a quiet and comfortable place
Close your eyes and relax your shoulders
Inhale slowly through your nose for 4 seconds
Exhale slowly through your mouth for 6 seconds

stretching.title: Morning Stretching
stretching.description: Start your day with energy and flexibility
steps: Stand up and stretch your arms upward
Gently rotate your neck in circles
Stretch your arms to the sides
Do forward bends, touching your toes

meditation.title: Quick Meditation
meditation.description: Find your inner peace in just minutes
steps: Close your eyes and relax your body
When thoughts arise, acknowledge them and let them go
Slowly open your eyes when finished

walking.title: Active Walk
walking.description: Move your body and clear your mind

visualRest.title: Visual Rest
steps: Look at a distant object for 20 seconds
Close your eyes and rest them

gratitude.title: Gratitude Practice
gratitude.description: End your day with a positive mindset
steps: Think of three positive things from your day
Reflect on why they are meaningful
Go to sleep with this positive feeling

muscleRelaxation.title: Muscle Relaxation
steps: Tense your feet for 5 seconds, then relax
Continue with each muscle group upward
Include arms, shoulders, neck, and face
Feel the full relaxation at the end

mindfulCoffee.title: Mindful Coffee
mindfulCoffee.description: Transform your coffee break into a moment of calm
steps: Observe the color, aroma, and temperature
Feel the temperature and flavor in your mouth
